Data Backup Strategy and Backup Media Control Compliant Organization

comment.undefined: Full Backup once per week, incremental or full Backup daily; Strategy is defined and documented, is implemented for the most important protected systems
No defined Backup strategy, sporadical backups
Full Backup once per week, incremental or full Backup daily; Strategy is defined and documented, is implemented for all protected systems

label.en: Data Security Handbook Control Compliant Organizaton
Air Conditioning Control Compliant Server Room
Electronic Commerce Services Control Compliant Organization

comment.en:
Policy should contain information about:

  • Selection and handling of passwords
  • Behaviour in case of security problems
  • Handling of sensitive data
  • Information about malware, viruses etc - how to identify those and steps to take in case of infection
  • How to detect suspicious mails (spams, phishing, virus-attachments, ...)
  • Risks and right behaviour when using the internet
  • Risks when using mobile IT-devices and data carrier
  • Data backup
  • Social engineering

Following points should be considered when employing new staff:

  • Background checks (also policy records if necessary and available, contact prior employer)
  • Keep a list of all handed out documents, keys, devices etc (need to be up to date)
  • Creation of own user account (with appropriate access rights)
  • Training Measures
  • "Staff Employment Checklist" should be generated to make sure all relevant points are covered.

Following Points must be considered on termination:

  • Returning of all documents, keys, devices etc, which have been handed out to the respective staff member
  • Deletion/revocation/adaption of access rights, specially remote access (teleworking)
  • Deletion of user account - account should not be reused for another person
  • Deletion of data on private IT-devices
  • Changing of all passwords that were shared with the released person and of those the person had access to
  • A "Staff Departure Checklist" must be created to make sure that all points will be considered on departure of staff

label.undefined: Unauthorized Use Prevention Control Compliant Organization

comment.undefined: Yes, there is a policy for the use of the internet; it was implemented by the works council or by employees by means of signature.
There is a policy, but users don't comply with it.

label.en: Private Software and Hardware Use Policy

comment.en:
Policy should contain information about:

  • Which Software is allowed to use and which not

Following points need to be taken in account:

  • Which IT-components are critical to run (compare to 'Application Evaluation Document'), is it possible to conclude a service contract?
  • How can IT-Components be compensated if they don’t work (correctly)?
  • Is it necessary to outsource emergency planning or are there (old) IT-Devices that can be used to compensate for emergency? Where should these devices be stored?
  • Detailed description of the process steps in emergency case (including tasks and responsibilities)

label.undefined: Restrictive Granting Of Access Rights Policy A

comment.undefined: Every user is allowed to use those functions and data, that he/she actually needs.

label.en: Physical Access Key Control Compliant Organization

comment.en:
Following points must be considered:
  • Every staff member must be educated about the sensitivness of data he/she is handling.
  • A concrete Role-Description is needed where all responsibilites and duties (and deputizing) are recorded - especially regarding the security-relevant positions
  • Every staff member needs to sign the "Data Secrecy Commitment" which must be in compliance with the DSG 2000.

label.en: Fire Extinguisher Control Compliant Server Room

comment.en:
The policy should contain information about:
  • Which configuration data needs to get stored (router, switch, ...)
  • In which way the hard copy recording is handeled (screen shots etc.)
  • Responsibilities of keeping the configuration data up to date
  • Storage of the configuration data
  • Authorized persons that can access the configuration data

label.en: Backup Storage In-House Control Compliant Backup Media

comment.en:
Policy should contain information about:

  • Procedure of evaluation
  • Steps how to identify the necessary IT components
  • A document must be created that contains these applications and relevant components ('Application Evaluation Document')
  • Responsibilites of keeping the Document up to date

Policy should contain information about:

  • Right placement of tele workingstation (eg seperated lockable room) and documents/data carrier
  • Data backup duties
  • Software that is allowed to be installed on tele workingstation
  • Decision if tele workingstation is offered from the organization or not

label.en: Access Control Regulation Control Compliant Organization

comment.en: A secure and lockable place/safe/locker outside the building, where backupdata, documents or contracts can be stored. Could be the homeplace of a staff member, a safe at a bank etc

Policy should contain:

  • Planned future expansion of organization, IT-devices and so on
  • Plan of current electric installation (document 'Electric Installation Plan')
  • Changements that must be considered on growing electric installation (air conditioning etc)
  • Decisions about Uninterruptible Power Supply Units:
    • Which devices should be connected to an UPS
    • Is an automatic shutdown of servers considered (software)
    • Are there regulary checks if the UPS functions correctly

comment.undefined: A clear desk policy for papers and removable storage media and a clear screen policy for information processing facilities shall be adopted.

label.en: Backup Storage Outside Control Compliant Backup Media

comment.en:
Policy should contain information about:

  • General information about risks of using removable media
  • list of allowed and disallowed removable media

Policy should contain information about:

  • Possible vulernabilities and risks when using a mobile device
  • Handling and locking
  • Required Software (Antivirus, Antitheft, etc)
  • Steps to take if device is stolen
  • List of allowed Apps/disallowed apps respectively which permissions an app is allowed to have
  • Prohibition of "Jailbreaking"
  • Determine when encryption is necessary (for stored data and for conncetio
  • Deactivation of bluetooth/infrarot/gps if not required
  • Regulation in case of passing on the device/disposal of the device/departure of staff member

comment.en: A secure and lockable place/safe/locker within the building, where backupdata, documents or contracts can be stored

label.en: Physical Media Transit Control Compliant Organization

comment.undefined: Local Backups (e.g. via local tapedrivers of computers)
Central backup, central logging of Backups, in a room with access control, other fire compartment than the protected server
Central backup, central logging of Backups, in a room with access control, same fire compartment as the protected server

label.en: System Capacity Monitoring Control Compliant Organization

comment.en:
Following points need to be taken in account:

  • Data classification (e.g. business data, databases, system files, configuration data etc.)
  • Backup criteria for mobile Devices (PDA, Smartphone, Notebooks etc.)
  • Selection of the backup technology and the backup media
  • Backup intervals (depending on data classification the intervals might be different)
  • Backup method (full backup, incremental backup, disc image)
  • How many old backups must be held
  • Storage facilities for the backup media (within the building, and also a secure place outside the building)
  • Responsibilities for the backup process, monitoring and documentation
  • Access rights to the backup data
  • Checking and verifying process (backup recovery routine and tests)
comment.undefined: Back-up copies of information and software shall be taken and tested regularly in accordance with the agreed backup policy.

label.en: Maintenance Contract Control Compliant IT Component
Mobile Code Blocking Control Compliant Control

comment.en: Simple Firewall, mainly for private IT Components - not sufficient for organizational IT Components

label.en: Position Responsibilities and Deputizing Control Compliant Organization

comment.en:
Policy includes:

  • Which data is public/internal/sensitive.
  • Which data can be passed on and in which way (personal, by telephone, via mail..).
  • How does a person has to evidence his/her identity.
  • Checklist must be generated, so all staff can follow a step-by-step list to be sure they behave the right way.
  • Name of contact persons in case of unclear situatio.

Policy should contain:

  • Details about position of the access point (outside the building no access should be possible)
  • Changing of standard passwords
  • Encryption details, storage of the key
  • additional security measures like MAC-address filter, deactivating of DHCP-server

Policy should contain:

  • Information how the business stratetegy and the social media guidelines are compatible
  • In which way the organization will be present in which social media plattforms (and maybe also staff member)
  • Responsiblity for updates and support
  • Regulation of private use of social network plattforms
  • Revealation of risks/responsibilites/duties (cyber mobbing etc)

label.en: Physical Perimeter Protection Control Compliant Building

comment.undefined: Are the information security requirements needed for the business continuity addressed by an organization managed process? Are the business continuity plans tested and updated regularly? Is there a single framework plan to ensure the consistency of all plans?
Does the building have access control?
Is anti-virus software installed and updated on each client? Are all files analyzed by an anti virus scanner?

comment.en: A clear desk policy for papers and removable storage media and a clear screen policy for information processing facilities shall be adopted.

comment.undefined: Is the approach of the Information Security reviewed independently? Are there planned intervals to review it? Is it reviewed when significant changes occur?
Do the sections possess automated and tested alarm systems?
Secure areas shall be protected by appropriate entry controls to ensure that only authorized personnel are allowed access.
Is it appropriate to consider automatic equipment identification? It may be necessary to consider physical protection of the equipment to maintain the security of the equipment identifier.

comment.en: Is there an Uninterruptible Power Supply (UPS) available and is the runtime adequate?

comment.undefined: Are there formal procedures for the secure disposal of media?

Are the important assets identified in an inventory? Is the inventory maintained? Are the information processing facilities assets owned by a designed part of the organization? Are rules for acceptable use of assets identified, documented and implemented?
Is there a disciplinary process for employees who have committed a security breach?
Is the information about technical vulnerabilities obtained? Are the associated vulnerabilities evaluated? Are measures taken to address the associated risks?
Is the access of the visitors supervised? Are the date and time of entry and departure recorded?
Are the resources monitored? Are projections of future capacity requirements made?
Is there a system of authentication of remote users?

Are all applications patched / updated on a regular basis? Are patches / updates tested before deployment? Are workstations/laptops regularly updated? Have all vendor recommended security-related patches been applied?

labels.undefined: Security Relevant Patches And Updates Control

comment.undefined: Back-up copies of information and software shall be taken and tested regularly in accordance with the agreed backup policy.

Is there a system of logs that shows the users activities, exceptions and security events? Are there procedures for monitoring the use of information processing facilities? Are the monitored results reviewed regularly? Are the computer systems monitoring the resource usage? Is there a review of fault logs? Is there a review of corrective measures to ensure that controls have not been compromised?
Is there physical protection and guidelines for working in secure areas?
Are there agreements for the exchange of information and software between organization and external parties?
Is the awareness about information security risks and their influence in the business transmitted throughout of the organization?

Is there a formal procedure for user registration and de-registration? Is there a unique user ID? Are the groups ID supervised and documented? Is the formal record of all the registered users maintained?
Is there a logging and monitoring control?

Is the Information Security Policy being complied? Are all the legal, regulatory and contractual requirements and the organizations approach defined, documented and updated? Are there appropriate procedures implemented to ensure compliance with IPR on the use of property software? Is data protection and privacy in compliance with legal and contractual clauses? Are cryptographic controls in compliance with laws, agreements and regulations?

Is the electronic commerce information protected against fraud, unauthorized disclosure or modification? Are the on-line transactions protected to prevent incomplete transmission, message alteration, mis-routing, message duplication or replay?
Is the physical access to diagnostic and configuration ports controlled? Is the logical access to diagnostic and configuration ports controlled?

labels.undefined: Port Security Diagnostic And Configuration Control

comment.undefined: Are fire extinguishers available in the section?
Are there authentication techniques to identify a user?
Are validation checks incorporated into applications? Are validation checks applied to the input data? Are data output validated to ensure that the information storage is correct?
Is the assignment of authorizations on the local systems carried out according to the principle of least privilege?

labels.undefined: Restrictive Granting Of Access Rights Control

comment.undefined: Are cryptographic control to uniquely authenticate mobile code?

Is the sensitive information classified properly? Has the output sensitive information an appropriate classification label? Are there obvious signs to identify the presence of information processing facilities? Is the system documentation protected and stored securely? Is the information exposed in the public network properly protected?
Is the network protected by a firewall from the internet.
Are the users aware of the scope of their permitted access? Are there warning messages to indicate that it is not permitted the unauthorized access to the information processing facility?
Does the organization maintain contacts with relevant authorities and special interest groups or security specialist?
Users shall be deterred from using information processing facilities for unauthorized purposes.
Is the access to delivery and loading areas restricted to the identified and authorized personnel?
Floors on the ground level are easily reachable and vulnerable to flooding.
Is the network divided into separated logical domains?

Are the security perimeters clearly defined? Are the important perimeters physically sound? Are the external wall made of a solid construction? Are the doors suitably protected against unauthorized access? Are the doors and windows locked?
Is a formal testing and acquisition process followed when a new product is purchased?
Are the risks identified? Are their probability, impact and consequences identified?

Is there an Information Security Policy? Is it communicated to all employees and external parties? Is the use of unauthorized software included in the policy? Is the use of network and network services defined? Is it included an access control category in the policy? Is it included the use of cryptographic controls category?

Are the new facilities managed by authorization process? Are their hardware and software checked to ensure that they are compatible with other system components? Is there an acceptance criteria for new information systems and upgrades?
Is a procedure for logging into an operating system designed? Does it minimize the opportunity for unauthorized access? Does it disclose the minimum of information about the system?
Is there a commitment of the management to support actively the security? Is there a co-ordination of the security activities from different part of the organization?
Is the IT system physically locked (Kensington Lock).
Is the cabling protected for interception or damage? Is the cabling and patch panel clearly identifiable and properly marked?
Are the operational procedures documented and maintained? Are available to the users who need them?

Is the equipment sited minimizing unnecessary access to work areas? Are the information processing facilities positioned in order to reduce the risk of unauthorized access? Are special items isolated?
Is the information involved in electronic messaging appropriately protected?
Are the combustible and dangerous materials stored at a safe distance from a secure area? Are bulk supplies stored within a secure area? Is the back-up media stored in a safe location?
Are the organizational records protected from loss, destruction and falsification? Are they in accordance with statutory, regulatory, and business requirements?
Does the server room possess an air conditioning (or HVAC Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning) system to reduce the threat of inadmissible humidity and temperature?
Is the media containing information that is being transported properly protected?
Are the security features, services levels, and management requirements of all network services included in a services network agreement?

Is the third party service delivery agreement implemented, operated and maintained by the third party? Are the services, reports and records provided by the third party regularly monitored and reviewed? Are the changes of their services properly managed?
Are the data backups stored securely.
Is there a visible identification for all employees, contractors, third party users and visitors?
Are the clocks of information processing systems synchronized?
Are the routing controls implemented in order not to breach the access control policy?
Are changes controlled by formal procedures? Are these changes control procedures documented and enforced? Is a risk assessment included in this process?
Are all doors and windows locked after working hours?
Are guidelines established for human behaviour in the proximity to information processing facilities?
Is the area scanned of outbound media and communications to reduce information leakage risk?
Is a lightning arrestor in place.
Are fire extinguishers available in the server room?
Are the management responsibilities and procedures established to provide an effective response to information security incidents?
Are environmental conditions monitored?

label.en: Network Logging And Monitoring Control Compliant Organization
Security Management Framework Control Compliant Organization

comment.undefined: Organization under review

comment.en:
Policy should consider following points:

  • Differentiation of External Staff (House Keeping vs , longterm vs shortterm
  • Confidentality Agreement must be part of contract
  • Agreement to contractual duty of secrecy, relevant laws, internal regulations etc. - depending on concrete position of external staff member
  • Dealing with visitors and short-term staff (eg electrician)

label.en: Information Security Independent Review Control Compliant Organization

comment.en:
Policy should contain information about:

  • Responsible persons, that can be contacted in case virus infection is suspected
  • Intial Measures to stop spreading of viruses
  • Updates of Antivirus Software
  • Contact other organizations/customers in case they have received infected mails
  • Recovery strategies

label.en: PC, Internet and Email Regulation Policy

comment.en:
Following points are part of this Policy:

  • PC Use Regulation
  • Restriction of Internet and Email Use (e.g. security settings in web browsers, no automatic opening of mail attachments, ..)
  • Selection of adequate passwords and handling with passwords (using different passwords for different services etc)
  • E-Mail: displaying of attachment-ending, disabling of automatic opening and so on
  • Activation of Antivirus Software, conductiong regular checks, .

A risk analysis regarding the planned outsourcing must be conducted before.

Each contract should consider following points:

  • Compliance with the Austrian „Datenschutzgesetz 2000“
  • Responsibilities and penalties of the Service Provider and the Organization
  • Reporting
  • Contract termination, early termination of contract due to insufficient service, Consequences in case of breach of contract
  • Terms of payment, delay of payment
  • Terms of supply, (including what happens on delay of supply)

label.en: Water Alarm System Control Compliant Section

comment.en:
Before Hiring Staff:

  • Background Checks

 When already hired:

  • Access Rights for Workstations
  • Physical Access Rights
  • List of all handed out documents, devices, keys etc
Checklist that contains all necessary steps to take, (e.g. when a virus infection has occured)

• Delete accounts, access rights
  • Change shared passwor
  • Hand in all devices, documents, keys etc the employee has received by the organization
Checklist for staff to take dicision which information can be passed to whom and which controls might be necessary (e.g. return call to be sure the caller is the person he/she pretents to be)

label.en: Environmental Conditions Monitoring Control Compliant Section

comment.en: Configuration Data of Routers, Switches etc. that are stored in a digital format.

Policy should contain information about:

  • Which areas of the building need to be protected?
  • Determination of security priorities to protectable sections
  • Who has access/is allowed to access these sections
  • Which steps are necessary to get access (protocol, key, etc)
  • Access Control Measurements (like logging of certain data, eg. time of access, reason for access)

label.en: Electronic Messaging Protection Control Compliant Organization

label.undefined: PC and Internet Control Compliant Organization

comment.en:
Policy should contain:

  • Short description about each position
  • Responsibilites and duties
  • Handled data and information (e.g. senstive customer data)
  • Representative(s)

Policy should contain information about:

  • Responsibility of notification
  • Way of notification
  • Legal advisors, that can be contacted in case of unclear situations

label.en: Information Security Policy Document Control Compliant Organization

comment.en:
Following should be considered:

  • Storing in house should be in a physical separate and secure location (lockable)
  • Backup media should regularly be stored in a secure place outside the building (case of fire etc) e.g. in a bank safe
  • Only authorized persons should get access to backup media

comment.undefined: Media containing information should be protected against unauthorized access, misuse or corruption.
Information involved in electronic messaging should be appropriately protected.
Formal exchange policies, procedures and controls should be in place to protect the exchange of information through the use of all types of communication facilities.

labels.undefined: A.10.8.1 Information exchange policies and procedures

comment.undefined: Agreements should be established for the exchange of information and software between the organization and external parties.
Policies and procedures should be developed and implemented to protect information associated with the interconnection of business information systems.
Important records should be protected from loss, destruction, and falsification, in accordance with statutory, regulatory, contractual, and business requirements.
Data protection and privacy should be ensured as required in relevant legislation, regulations, and, if applicable, contractual clauses.

labels.undefined: A.15.1.4 Data protection and privacy of personal information

comment.undefined: Users should be deterred from using information processing facilities for unauthorized purposes.

labels.undefined: A.15.1.5 Prevention of misuse of information processing facilities

comment.undefined: Cryptographic controls should be used in compliance with all relevant agreements, laws, and regulations.
An information security policy document should be approved by management, and published and communicated to all employees and relevant external parties.
The information security police should be reviewed at planned intervals or if significant changes occur to ensure its continuing suitability, adequacy, and effectiveness.

labels.undefined: A.5.1.2 Review of the information security policy

comment.undefined: All relevant statutory, regulatory, and contractual requirements and the organizations approach to meet these requirements should be explicitly defined, documented, and kept up to date for each information system and the organization.

Appropriate procedures should be implemented to ensure compliance with legislative, regulatory, and contractual requirements on the use of material in respect of which there may be intellectual property rights and on the use of proprietary software products.
To ensure the security of system files.
To maintain the security of application system software and information.

labels.undefined: A.12.5 Security in development and suport process

comment.undefined: To reduce risks resulting from exploitation of published technical vulnerabilities.
To ensure that security is an integral part of information systems.

labels.undefined: A.12.1 Security requirements of information systems

comment.undefined: Detection, prevention, and recovery controls to protect against malicious code and appropriate user awareness procedures shall be implemented.
To prevent errors, loss, unauthorized modification or misuse of information in applications.
To protect the confidentiality, authenticity or integrity of information by cryptographic means.

Where the use of mobile code is authorized, the configuration should ensure that the authorised mobile code operates according to a clearly defined security policy, and unauthorized mobile code should be prevented from executing.
There should be procedures in place to control the installation of software on operational systems.
Test data should be selected carefully, and protected and controlled.

labels.undefined: A.12.4.2 Protection of system test data

comment.undefined: There should be a formal user registration and de-registration procedure in place for granting and revoking access to all information systems and services.
To detect unauthorized information processing facilities.
The allocation and use of privileges should be restricted and controlled.
The allocation of passwords should be controlled through a formal management process.
Management should review users access rights at regular intervals using a formal process.

labels.undefined: A.11.2.4 Review of user access rights

comment.undefined: Access to information and application system functions by users and support personnel shall be restricted in accordance with the defined access control policy.
Sensitive systems should have a dedicated (isolated) computing environment.
Management responsibilities and procedures should be established to ensure a quick, effective, and orderly response to information security incidents.

All employees of the organization and, where relevant, contractors and third party users should receive the appropriate awareness training and regular updates in organizational policies and procedures, as relevant for their job function.

labels.undefined: A.8.2.2 Information security awareness, education, and training

comment.undefined: There should be mechanisms in place to enable the types, volumes, and costs of information security incidents to be quantified and monitored.

labels.undefined: A.13.2.2 Learning from information security incidents

comment.undefined: Where a follow-up action against a person or organization after an information security incident involves legal action (either civil or criminal) evidence should be collected, retained, and presented to conform to the rules for evidence laid down in the relevant jurisdiction(s).
There should be a formal disciplinary process for employees who have committed a security breach.
To maintain the security of the organization's information and information processing facilities that are accessed, processed, communicated to, or managed by external parties.
To manage information security within the organization.
Management should require employees, contractors and third party users to apply security in accordance with established policies and procedures of the organization.
Access to program source coude should be restricted.

labels.undefined: A.12.4.3 Access control to program source

comment.undefined: Information involved in on-line transactions should be protected to prevent incomplete transmission, mis-routing, unauthorized message alteration, unauthorized disclosure, unauthorized message duplication or replay.
The integrity of information being made available on a publicy available system should be protected to prevent unauthorized modification.
Information involved in electronic commerce passing over public networks should be  protected from fraudulent activity, contract dispute, and unauthorized disclosure and modification.
To avoid breaches of any law, statutory, regulatory or contractual obligations, and of any security requirements.
To prevent unauthorized access to operating systems.
Operating procedures should be documented, maintaned, and made available to all users who need them.
To ensure compliance of systems with organizational security policies and standards.

labels.undefined: A.15.2 Compliance with security policies and standards and technical compliance

comment.undefined: To prevent unauthorized access to information held in application systems.

labels.undefined: A.11.6 Application and information access control

comment.undefined: To ensure information security when using mobile computing and teleworking facilities.
Duties and areas of responsibility should be segregated to reduce opportunities for unauthorized or unintenational modification or misuse of the organization's assets.
To maximize the effectiveness of and to minimize interference to/from the information systems audit process.
Changes to information processing facilities and systems should be controlled.
To control to acces to information.

labels.undefined: A.11.1 Business requirement for access control

comment.undefined: Development, test, and operational facilities should be separated to reduce risks of unathorised access or changes to the operational system.

labels.undefined: A.10.1.4 Separation of development, test, and operational facilities

comment.undefined: To ensure authorized user access and to prevent unauthorized access to information systems.
To prevent unauthorized user access, and compromise or theft of information and information processing facilities.
To prevent unauthorized access to networked services.
Back-up copies of information and software shall be taken and tested regularly in accordance with the agreed backup policy.
The implementation of changes should be controlled by the use of formal change control procedures.
Statements of business requirements for new information systems, or enhancements to existing information systems should specify the requirements for security controls.

labels.undefined: A.12.1.1 Security requirements analysis and specification

comment.undefined: Users should be required to follow good security practices in the selection and use of passwords.
Users should ensure that unattended equipment has appropriate protection.
A clear desk policy for papers and removable storage media and a clear screen policy for information processing facilities shall be adopted.

labels.undefined: A.11.3.3 Clear desk and clear screen policy

comment.undefined: A formal policy should be in place, and appropriate security measures should be adopted to protect against the risks of using mobile computing and communication facilities.
A policy, operational plans and procedures should be developed and implemented for teleworking activities.
To prevent loss, damage, theft or compromise of assets and interruption to the organization's activities.

As part of their contractual obligation, employeesm contractors and third party users should agree and sign the terms and conditions of their emplyment contract, which should state their and the organization's responisibilities for information security.

labels.undefined: A.8.1.3 Terms and conditions of employment

comment.undefined: To prevent unauthorized physical access, damage and interference to the organization's premises and information.

To provide management direction and support for information security in 
accordance with business requirements and relevant laws and regulations.
Audit logs recording user activities, exceptions, and information security events should be produced and kept for an agreed period to assist in future investigations and access control monitoring.
Faults should be logged, analysed, and appropriate action taken.
Opportunities for information leakage should be prevented.
Security roles and responsibilities of employees, contractors should be defined and documented in accordance with the organization's information security police.
Outsourced software development should be supervised and monitored by the organization.
System administrator and system operator activities should be logged.

Background verification checks on all candidates for employment, contractors, and third party users should be carried out in accordance with relevant laws, regulations and ethics, and proportional to the business requirements, the classification of the information to be accessed, and the perceived risks.
Logging facilities and log information should be protected against tampering and unauthorized access.
When operating systems are changed, business critical applications should be reviewed and tested to ensure there is no adverse impact on organizational operations or security.

labels.undefined: A.12.5.2 Technical review of applications after operating system changes

comment.undefined: Modifications to software packages should be discouraged, limited to necessary changes, and all changes should be strictly controlled.

labels.undefined: A.12.5.3 Restrictions on changes to software packages

comment.undefined: Procedures for monitoring use of information processing facilities should be established and the results of the monitoring activities reviewed regularly.
Equipment shall be sited or protected to reduce the risks from environmental threats and hazards, and opportunities for unauthorized access.
Equipment shall be protected from power failures and other disruptions caused by failures in supporting utilities.
Power and telecommunications cabling carrying data or supporting information services should be protected from interception or damage.
Equipment should be correctly maintained to ensure its continued availability and integrity
The clocks of all relevant information processing systems within an organization or security domain should be synchronized with an agreed accurate time source.
Security should be applied to off-site taking into account the different risks working outside the organization's premises
Events that can cause interruptions to business processes should be identified, along with the probability and impact of such interruptions and their consequences for information security.

labels.undefined: A.14.1.2 Business continuity and risk assessment

comment.undefined: Plans should be developed and implemented to maintain or restore operations and ensure availability of information at the required level and in the required time scales following interruption to, or failure of, critical business processes.

labels.undefined: A.14.1.3 Developing and implementing continuity plans including information security

comment.undefined: All items of equipment containing storage media should be checked to ensure that any sensitive data and licensed software has been removed or securely overwritten prior to disposal.

labels.undefined: A.9.2.6 Secure disposed or re-use of equipment

comment.undefined: Equipment, information or software should not be taken off-site without prior authorization.

A managed process should be developed and maintained for business continuity throughout the organization that addresses the information security requirements needed for the organizations business continuity.

labels.undefined: A.14.1.1 Including information security in the business continuity management process

comment.undefined: Audit requirements and activities involving checks on operational systems should be carefully planned and agreed to minimize the risk of disruptions to business processes.
Access to information systems audit tools should be protected to prevent any possible misuse or compromise.

labels.undefined: A.15.3.2 Protection of information systems audit tools

comment.undefined: To ensure the correct and secure operation of information processing facilities.
Appropriate contacts with special interest groups or other specialist security forums and professional associations should be maintained.

labels.undefined: A.6.1.7 Contact with special interest groups

comment.undefined: The organization's approach to managing information security and its implementation should be reviewed independently at planned interval, or when significant changes to the security implementation occur.

labels.undefined: A.6.1.8 Independent review of information security

comment.undefined: Requirements for confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements reflecting the organization's needs for the protection of information should be identified and regularly reviewed.
Approrpriate contacts with relevant authorities should be maintained.
All information security responsibilities should be clearly defined.

labels.undefined: A.6.1.3 Allocation of information security responsibilities

comment.undefined: To ensure the protection of information in networks and the protection of the supporting infrastructure.
To prevent unauthorized disclosure, modification, removal or destruction of assets, and interruption to business activities.
A management authorization process for new information processing facilities should be defined and implemented.

labels.undefined: A.6.1.4 Authorization process for information processing facilities

comment.undefined: A single framework of business continuity plans should be maintained to ensure all plans are consistent, to consistently address information security requirements, and to identify priorities for testing and maintenance.
Management should actively support security within the organization through clear direction, demonstrated commitment, explicit assignment, and acknowledgment of information security responsibilities.

labels.undefined: A.6.1.1 Management commitment to information security

comment.undefined: The services, reports and records provided by the third party provided by the third party should be regularly monitored and reviewed, and audits should be carried out regularly.

labels.undefined: A.10.2.2 Monitoring and review of third party services

comment.undefined: To maintain the security of information and software exchanged within an organization and with exaternal activity.
Information securit activities should be co-ordinated by representatives from differents parts of the organization with relevant roles and job functions.
To ensure the security of electronic commerce services, and their secure use.

It should be ensured that the security controls, service definitions and delivery levels included in the third party service delivery agreement are implemented, operated, and maintained by the third party.
Business continuity plans should be tested and updated regularly to ensure that they are up to date and effective.

labels.undefined: A.14.1.5 Testing, maintaining and re-assessing business continuity plans

comment.undefined: To implement and maintain the appropriate level of information security and service delivery in line with third party service delivery agreements.

labels.undefined: A.10.2 Third party services delivery management

comment.undefined: Networks shall be adequately managed and controlled, in order to be protected from threats, and to maintain security for the systems and applications using the network, including information in transit.
To minimize the risk of system failures.

Security features, service levels, and management requirements of all network services should be identified and included in any network services agreement, wether these services are provided in-house or outsourced.

Changes to the provision of services, including maintaining and improving existing information security policies, procedures and controls, should be managed, taking account of the criticality of business systems and processes involved and re-assessment of risks.

labels.undefined: A.10.2.3 Managing changes to third party services

comment.undefined: To protect the integrity of software and information.

labels.undefined: A.10.4 Protection against malicious and mobile code

comment.undefined: To counteract interruptions to business activities and to protect critical business processes from the effects of major failures of information systems or disasters and to ensure their timely resumption.

labels.undefined: A.14.1 Information security aspects of business continuity management

comment.undefined: To maintain the integrity and availability of information and information processing facilities.
Requirements for ensuring authenticity and protecting message integrity in applications should be identified, and appropriate controls identified and implemented.
Data output from an application should be validated to ensure that the processing of stored information is correct and appropriate to the circumstances.
Data input to applications should be validated to ensure that this data is correct and appropriate.
Validation checks should be incorporated into applications to detect any corruption of information through processing errors or deliberate acts.
Information should be classified in terms of its value, legal requirements, sensitivity, and criticality to the organization.
An appropriate set of procedures for unformation labeling and handling should be developed and implemented in accordance with the classification scheme adopted by the organization.
Users should only be provided with access to the services that they have been specifically authorized to use.

labels.undefined: A.11.4.1 Policy on use of network services

comment.undefined: Appropriate authentication methods should be used to control access by remote users.

labels.undefined: A.11.4.2 User authentication for external connections

comment.undefined: Automatic equipment identification should be considered as a means to authenticate connections from specific locations and equipment.
Physical and logical access to diagnostic and configuration ports should be controlled.

labels.undefined: A.11.4.4 Remote diagnostic and configuration port protection

comment.undefined: To ensure that employees, contractors and third party users exit an organization or change employment in an oderly manner.

labels.undefined: A.8.3 Termination or change of employment

comment.undefined: Groups of information services, users, and information systems should be segregated on networks.

For shared networks, especially those extending across the organizations boundaries, the capability of users to connect to the network should be restricted, in line with the access control policy and requirements of the business applications.

To ensure that employees, contractors and third party users are aware of information security threats and concerns, their responsibilities and liabilities, and are equipped to support organizational security polocy in the course of their normal work, and to reduce the risk of human error.
Routing controls should be implemented for networks to ensure that computer connections and information flows do not breach the access control policy of the business applications.

To ensure that employees, contractors and third party users understand their responsabilities, and are suitable for the roles they are considered for, and to reduce the risk of theft, fraud or misuse of facilities.

Timely information about technical vulnerabilities of information systems being used shall be obtained, the organization's exposure to such vulnerabilities evaluated, and appropriate measures taken to address the associated risk.
System documentation should be protected against unauthorized access.
Secure areas shall be protected by appropriate entry controls to ensure that only authorized personnel are allowed access.

labels.undefined: A.12 Information systems acquisition, development and maintenance

comment.undefined: Physical security offices, rooms, and facilities shoud be designed and applied.

labels.undefined: A.9.1.3 Securing offices, rooms, and facilities

comment.undefined: Media should be disposed of securely and safely when no longer required, using formal procedures.
Physical protection against damage from fire, flood, earthquake, explosion, civil unrest, and other forms of natural or man-made disaster shall be designed and applied.

labels.undefined: A.9.1.4 Protecting against external and environmental threats

comment.undefined: Physical protection and guidelines for working in secure areas should be designed and apllied.
Procedures for the handling and storage of information should be established to protect this information from unauthorized disclosure of misuse.

Access points such a delivery and loading areas and other points where unauthorized persons may enter the premises should be controlled and, if possible, isolated from information processing facilities to avoid unauthorized access.

labels.undefined: A.9.1.6 Public access, delivery, and loading areas

comment.undefined: Information systems should be regularly checked for compliance with security implementation standards.
Security perimeters (barriers such as walls, card controlled entry gates or manned reception desks) shall be used to protect areas that contain information and information processing facilities.
Managers should ensure that all security procedures within their area of responsibility are carried out correctly to achieve compliance with security policies and standards.

labels.undefined: A.15.2.1 Compliance with security policies and standards

comment.undefined: All identified security requirements should be addressed before giving customers access to the organizations information or assets.

labels.undefined: A.6.2.2 Addressing security when dealing with customers

comment.undefined: The use of resources should be monitored, tuned, and projections made of future capacity requirements to ensure the required system perfomance.

Agreements with third parties involving accessing, processing, communicating or managing the organization's information or information processing facilities, or adding products or services ot information processing facilities should cover all relevant security requirements.

labels.undefined: A.6.2.3 Addressing security in third party agreements

comment.undefined: The risks to organization's information and information processing facilities from business processes involving external parties should be indetified and appropiate controls implemented before granting acces.

labels.undefined: A.6.2.1 Identification of risks related to external parties

comment.undefined: There should be procedures in place for the management of removable media.
To ensure information security events and weaknesses associated with information systems are communicated in a manner allowing timely corrective action to be taken.

labels.undefined: A.13.1 Reporting information security events and weaknesses

comment.undefined: Acceptance criteria of new information systems, upgrades, and new versions should be established and suitable tests of the system(s) carried out during development and prior to acceptance.
To ensure a consistent and effective approach is applied to the management of information security incidents.

labels.undefined: A.13.2 Management of information security incidents and improvements

comment.undefined: Key management should be in place to support the organizations use of cryptographic techniques.
A policy on the use of cryptographic controls for protection of information should be developed and implemented.

labels.undefined: A.12.3.1 Policy on the use of cryptographic controls

comment.undefined: All assets should be clearly identified and an inventory of all important assets drawn up and maintained.
An access control policy should be established, documented, and reviewed based on business and security requirements for access.
All information assets associated with processing facilities shoul be owned by a desingated part of the organization.
Rules for the acceptable use of information and assets associated with information processing facilities should be identified, documented, and implemented.
Access to operating systems should be controlled by a secure log-on procedure.
All users should have a unique identifier (user ID) for their personal use only, and a suitable authentication technique should be chosen to substantiate the claimed identity of a user.

The access rights of all employees, contractors and third party users to information and information processing facilities should be removed upon termination of their emplyment, contract or agreement, or adjusted upon change.
Information security events should be reported through appropriate management channels as quickly as possible.
Systems for managing passwords should be interactive and should ensure quality passwords.
All employees, contractors and third party users of information systems and services should be required to note and report any observed or suspected security weaknesses in systems or services.
The use of utility programs that might be capable of overriding system and application controls should be restricted and tightly controlled.
Responsibilities for perfoming employment termination or change of employment should be clearly defined and assigned.
Inactive sessions should shut down after a defined period of inactivity.
All employees, contractors and third party users should return all of the organization's assets in their possesion upon termination of their employment, contract agreement.
Restrictions on connection times should be used to provide additional security for high-risk applications.
To ensure that information receives an appropriate level of protection.
To achieve and maintain appropriate protection of organizational assets.

label.undefined: Media And Communication Scanning Control Compliant Organization

comment.en:
Policy contains information about:

  • Which data needs to be disposed in which way.
  • Diffentation between hardcopies, data carriere, software etc.

Disks or other media, that contain installation files for system recovery

l

Policy should contain information about:

  • Methode of archiving and used media
  • Responsibilities for archiving
  • 'Data Carrier Stock Document' - must be kept up to date
  • Control and testing of archives
  • Backups
Special extinguisher to protect IT components

label.en: Restrictive Granting of Access Rights Control Compliant Organization

comment.en: Encryption of the entire harddrive - user has to log in with an encryption-password when booting the PC

label.en: Network Services Agreement Control Compliant Organization
Data Encryption Software Control Compliant Computer

comment.en: Configuration Data of Routers, Switches etc. that are stored as Hard Copy Documents.

label.en: Human Behavior Guidelines Control Compliant Control Organization

comment.en:
Policy should contain:

  • Regulation that every connection between internet and the internal network must be secured with a firewall
  • Decision if Internet Provider should be responsible for firewall-services (Managed Security Contract) or not
  • Updates for firewalls - who is responsible, when do the update
  • Configuration and administration of firewall - must be possible through a secure connection
  • Configuration information - where and how to store, keep up to date
  • Determination which connections to and from the internal network are allowed and disallowed
  • Determination of Logging-Level and responsibilty for regular checking of logging-files
  • Configuration of Personal Firewalls

Following points need to be taken in account:

  • Assure immediate availability of necessary installation files, backups etc.
  • Creation of a step-by-step plan to recover including responsibilities (could e.g. result in a checklist ‘Emergency Recovery Checklist’)
  • Testing of the recovery plan

label.en: Theft Protection Control Compliant Mobile Device
Delivery And Loading Areas Control Compliant Building
Audit Logging And Monitoring Control Compliant Organization

label.undefined: Change Control Procedures Control Compliant Control

label.en: User Identification Authentication Control Compliant Organization

comment.en:
Policy should contain:

  • Who is allowed to have access to which area?
  • Are there any security relevant measures to take before enter such an area?
  • Where are the distribution of keys documented and who is responsible for updating that document ('Physical Access Key Management Control')
  • Duties and responsbilites for key owner

label.undefined: Security Relevant Patches And Updates Policy

comment.en:
Policie includes:

  • What time Software needs to be updated
  • Decision if automatic Updates are allowed and if so, which software can be updated automatically (e.g. web browsers)
  • Who updates/patches software
  • Who is responsible to test the update/patch before installing it on all components
comment.undefined: Are all applications patched / updated on a regular basis? Are patches / updates tested before deployment? Are workstations/laptops regularly updated? Have all vendor recommended security-related patches been applied?

label.en: Port Security Diagnostic And Configuration Control Compliant Organization
Human Resource Development Control Compliant Organization

label.undefined: Security Relevan tPatches And Updates Policy A

comment.undefined: Version is supported by the software manufacturer. Security-relevant Patches/Hotfixes are applied, active further development on the part of the software manufacturer. Information search on security holes. Measures for preventing the Patch risk (check, test in advance, manual approval of installation). Documentation of changes.

comment.en: Firewall Service provided by the Internet Provider

label.undefined: Security Relevan tPatches And Updates Policy B

comment.undefined: Version is supported by the software manufacturer. Security-relevant Patches/Hotfixes are applied, no active further development on the part of the software manufacturer.

label.undefined: Security Relevan tPatches And Updates Policy C

comment.undefined: Version is supported by the software manufacturer. Security-relevant Patches/Hotfixes are not applied.

comment.en:
Defines the terms of a Service Contract plus:

  • Service Level Agreement:
    • Availability (percentage per week, month or year must be declared)
    • Performance, Scalability
    • Response time
    • Recovery time
    • Maintenance time
    • Security measures (cryptography - storage and transfer of data, data integrity, access protection)
  • Details about the cloud: e.g. information about the system, implemented security standards
  • Where will the data be stored (e.g. data center, country)? – Relevant for legal issues.
  • Compliance with the Austrian "Datenschutzgesetz 2000" must be assured (especially processing of sensitive Data)
  • Emergency plan of the cloud provider
